statements: UPDATE Inventory SET current_stock = 50, reorder_point = 20 WHERE product_id = 101
UPDATE Inventory SET supplier_id = 202, product_category = 'Electronics' WHERE product_id = 102
UPDATE Inventory SET current_stock = 1000, reorder_point = 200 WHERE product_id = 101 AND supplier_id = 201
UPDATE Inventory SET product_category = 'Electronics', current_stock = 500, reorder_point = 100 WHERE product_name = 'Laptop'
UPDATE inventory SET current_stock = 100 WHERE product_id = 1;
UPDATE sales_data SET sale_amount = 200.50, customer_name = 'John Doe' WHERE sale_id = 100;
UPDATE inventory SET current_stock = current_stock - 5, replenishment_schedule = 'Weekly' WHERE product_id = 1001;
UPDATE sales_data SET sale_amount = sale_amount * 1.1, customer_name = 'New Customer' WHERE sale_id = 2005;
UPDATE Inventory SET quantity = 20, last_reorder_date = '2022-05-10' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Sales SET total_price = 150.75, sale_date = '2022-05-15' WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE Inventory SET quantity = quantity + 10, reorder_point = 20 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Sales SET quantity_sold = 25, total_price = 500.25 WHERE product_id = 2 AND sale_date = '2022-03-15';
UPDATE Inventory SET current_stock = 50 WHERE product_id = 101;
UPDATE SalesData SET sale_amount = 150.75, sale_date = '2022-10-15' WHERE sale_id = 201;
UPDATE Inventory SET current_stock = current_stock - 5, reorder_point = reorder_point + 2 WHERE product_id = 1;
UPDATE SalesData SET sale_amount = sale_amount + 50.75, sale_date = '2022-03-15' WHERE sale_id = 10;
UPDATE inventory SET quantity = 50, reorder_point = 20 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE products SET price = 25.99, stock_level = stock_level + 10 WHERE product_id = 3;
UPDATE inventory SET quantity = quantity - 5 WHERE id = 1001;
UPDATE products SET price = price * 1.1, stock_level = stock_level + 50 WHERE supplier_id = 2001;
